Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • Point

  • public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that describes a Point object as a pair of coordinates (x, y)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Point()
      Constructor with no parameters.
      Point(int px, int py)
      Constructor with parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int distance(Point other)
      Uses the distance formula to return the distance between this point and another point, casted to an int.
      int getX()
      Accessor: Returns x-coordinate
      int getY()
      Accessor: Returns y-coordinate
      void move(int dx, int dy)
      Modifier method that moves the point.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Accessor method that returns a String representing the point.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Point

        public Point()
        Constructor with no parameters. Sets x and y equal to 0.

      • Point

        public Point(int px,
             int py)
        Constructor with parameters. Sets the instance variables equal to the parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • distance

        public int distance(Point other)
        Uses the distance formula to return the distance between this point and another point, casted to an int. Notice the parameter is ANOTHER Point object, different from "this" one. We can call the methods on that other Point object.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Accessor: Returns x-coordinate

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Accessor: Returns y-coordinate

      • move

        public void move(int dx,
                 int dy)
        Modifier method that moves the point.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Accessor method that returns a String representing the point.
